LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: compare and contrast works of literature that express a universal theme.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: compare and contrast the similarities and differences in classical plays with their modern day novel, play, or film versions.

LearningStandard.Description: relate the characters, setting, and theme of a literary work to the historical, social, and economic ideas of its time.

LearningStandard.Description: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Poetry. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the structure and elements of poetry and provide evidence from text to support their understanding.

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: analyze the effect of ambiguity, contradiction, subtlety, paradox,
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: analyze how the author's patterns of imagery, literary allusions, and conceits reveal theme, set tone, and create meaning in metaphors, passages, and literary works.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Culture and History. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about the author's purpose in cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts and provide evidence from the text to support their
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: analyze the consistency and clarity of the expression of the controlling idea and the ways in which the organizational and rhetorical patterns of text support or confound the author's meaning or purpose.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Expository Text. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about expository text and provide evidence from text to support their understanding.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: summarize a text in a manner that captures the author's viewpoint, its main ideas, and its elements without taking a position or expressing an opinion.

LearningStandard.Description: explain how authors writing on the same issue reached different conclusions because of differences in assumptions, evidence, reasoning, and viewpoints.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: make and defend subtle inferences and complex conclusions about the ideas in text and their organizational patterns.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: synthesize ideas and make logical connections (e.g., thematic links, author analysis) among multiple texts representing similar or different genres and technical sources and support those findings with textual evidence.

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: evaluate how messages presented in media reflect social and cultural views in ways different from traditional texts.

LearningStandard.Description: structure ideas in a sustained and persuasive way (e.g., using outlines, note taking, graphic organizers, lists) and develop drafts in timed and open-ended situations that include transitions and the rhetorical devices to convey meaning.

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: edit drafts for grammar, mechanics, and spelling.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: revise final draft in response to feedback from peers and teacher and publish written work for appropriate audiences.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: write an engaging story with a well-developed conflict and resolution, a clear theme, complex and non-stereotypical characters, a range of literary strategies (e.g., dialogue, suspense), devices to enhance the plot, and sensory details that define the mood or tone.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: write a poem that reflects an awareness of poetic conventions and traditions within different forms (e.g., sonnets, ballads, free verse).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: write an analytical essay of sufficient length that includes
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, English IV, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: follow the research plan to collect information from multiple sources of information, both oral and written, including
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 3, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Oral and Written Conventions/Spelling. Students spell correctly.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: spell words with more advanced orthographic patterns and rules
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: spell words with more advanced orthographic patterns and rules consonant changes (e.g., /t/ to /sh/ in select, selection; /k/ to /sh/ in music, musician).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: spell words with more advanced orthographic patterns and rules silent and sounded consonants (e.g., haste, hasten; sign, signal; condemn, condemnation).

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: know how to use the spell-check function in word processing while understanding its limitations.

LearningStandard.Description: Research/Research Plan. Students ask open-ended research questions and develop a plan for answering them.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: brainstorm, consult with others, decide upon a topic, and formulate open-ended questions to address the major research topic.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: generate a research plan for gathering relevant information about the major research question.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Research/Gathering Sources. Students determine, locate, and explore the full range of relevant sources addressing a research question and systematically record the information they gather.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: follow the research plan to collect data from a range of print and electronic resources (e.g., reference texts, periodicals, web pages, online sources) and data from experts.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: differentiate between primary and secondary sources.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: record data, utilizing available technology (e.g., word processors) in order to see the relationships between ideas, and convert graphic/visual data (e.g., charts, diagrams, timelines) into written notes.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: identify the source of notes (e.g., author, title, page number) and record bibliographic information concerning those sources according to a standard format.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: differentiate between paraphrasing and plagiarism and identify the importance of citing valid and reliable sources.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Research/Synthesizing Information. Students clarify research questions and evaluate and synthesize collected information.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: refine the major research question, if necessary, guided by the answers to a secondary set of questions.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: evaluate the relevance, validity, and reliability of sources for the research.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Research/Organizing and Presenting Ideas. Students organize and present their ideas and information according to the purpose of the research and their audience.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: compiles important information from multiple sources.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: develops a topic sentence, summarizes findings, and uses evidence to support conclusions.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: presents the findings in a consistent format.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: uses quotations to support ideas and an appropriate form of documentation to acknowledge sources (e.g., bibliography, works cited).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Listening and Speaking/Listening. Students use comprehension skills to listen attentively to others in formal and informal settings. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: listen to and interpret a speaker's messages (both verbal and nonverbal) and ask questions to clarify the speaker's purpose or perspective.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: follow, restate, and give oral instructions that include multiple action steps.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: determine both main and supporting ideas in the speaker's message.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Listening and Speaking/Speaking. Students speak clearly and to the point, using the conventions of language. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: give organized presentations employing eye contact, speaking rate, volume, enunciation, natural gestures, and conventions of language to communicate ideas effectively.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Listening and Speaking/Teamwork. Students work productively with others in teams. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: participate in student-led discussions by eliciting and considering suggestions from other group members and by identifying points of agreement and disagreement.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: establish purposes for reading selected texts based upon own or others` desired outcome to enhance comprehension.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: ask literal, interpretive, evaluative, and universal questions of text.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: monitor and adjust comprehension (e.g., using background knowledge, creating sensory images, rereading a portion aloud, generating questions).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: make inferences about text and use textual evidence to support understanding.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: summarize and paraphrase texts in ways that maintain meaning and logical order within a text and across texts.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: make connections (e.g., thematic links, author analysis) between and across multiple texts of various genres and provide textual evidence.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 5, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Reading/Fluency. Students read grade-level text with fluency and comprehension.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: adjust fluency when reading aloud grade-level text based on the reading purpose and the nature of the text.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Reading/Vocabulary Development. Students understand new vocabulary and use it when reading and writing.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: use context (e.g., cause and effect or compare and contrast organizational text structures) to determine or clarify the meaning of unfamiliar or multiple meaning words.

LearningStandard.Description: explain the meaning of foreign words and phrases commonly used in written English (e.g., RSVP, que sera sera).

LearningStandard.Description: use a dictionary, a glossary, or a thesaurus (printed or electronic) to determine the meanings, syllabication, pronunciations, alternate word choices, and parts of speech of words.

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: infer the implicit theme of a work of fiction, distinguishing theme from the topic.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: analyze the function of stylistic elements (e.g., magic helper, rule of three) in traditional and classical literature from various cultures.

LearningStandard.Description: compare and contrast the historical and cultural settings of two literary works.

LearningStandard.Description: explain how figurative language (e.g., personification, metaphors, similes, hyperbole) contributes to the meaning of a poem.

LearningStandard.Description: explain the similarities and differences in the setting, characters, and plot of a play and those in a film based upon the same story line.

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: identify the literary language and devices used in memoirs and personal narratives and compare their characteristics with those of an autobiography.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: explain how authors create meaning through stylistic elements and figurative language emphasizing the use of personification, hyperbole, and refrains.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Culture and History. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about the author's purpose in cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts and provide evidence from the text to support their
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: compare and contrast the stated or implied purposes of different authors writing on the same topic.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Expository Text. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about expository text and provide evidence from text to support their understanding.

LearningStandard.Description: summarize the main ideas and supporting details in text, demonstrating an understanding that a summary does not include opinions.

LearningStandard.Description: explain whether facts included in an argument are used for or against an issue.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: synthesize and make logical connections between ideas within a text and across two or three texts representing similar or different genres.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: compare and contrast the structure and viewpoints of two different authors writing for the same purpose, noting the stated claim and supporting evidence.

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: critique persuasive techniques (e.g., testimonials, bandwagon appeal) used in media messages.

LearningStandard.Description: analyze various digital media venues for levels of formality and informality.

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: plan a first draft by selecting a genre appropriate for conveying the intended meaning to an audience, determining appropriate topics through a range of strategies (e.g., discussion, background reading, personal interests, interviews), and developing a thesis or controlling idea.

LearningStandard.Description: develop drafts by choosing an appropriate organizational strategy (e.g., sequence of events, cause-effect, compare-contrast) and building on ideas to create a focused, organized, and coherent piece of writing.

LearningStandard.Description: revise drafts to clarify meaning, enhance style, include simple and compound sentences, and improve transitions by adding, deleting, combining, and rearranging sentences or larger units of text after rethinking how well questions of purpose, audience, and genre have been addressed.

LearningStandard.Description: edit drafts for grammar, mechanics, and spelling.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: revise final draft in response to feedback from peers and teacher and publish written work for appropriate audiences.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Writing/Literary Texts. Students write literary texts to express their ideas and feelings about real or imagined people, events, and ideas.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: create multi-paragraph essays to convey information about a topic that
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 6, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: read aloud in selected texts in ways that both reflect understanding of the text and engage the listeners (4-8).

LearningStandard.Description: read silently with increasing ease for longer periods (4-8).

LearningStandard.Description: read classic and contemporary works (2-8).

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.Description: use word origins as an aid to understanding historical influences on English word meanings (6-8).

LearningStandard.Description: use his/her own knowledge and experience to comprehend (4-8).

LearningStandard.Description: use study strategies to learn and recall important ideas from texts such as preview, question, reread, and record (6-8).

LearningStandard.Description: articulate and discuss themes and connections that cross cultures (4-8).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.Description: use resources to find correct spellings (4-8).

LearningStandard.Description: spell accurately in final drafts (4-8).

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.Description: employ standard English usage in writing for audiences, including subject-verb agreement, pronoun referents, and parts of speech (4-8).

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.Description: use available technology to support aspects of creating, revising, editing, and publishing texts (4-8).

LearningStandard.Description: refine selected pieces frequently to "publish" for general and specific audiences (4-8).

LearningStandard.Description: apply criteria to evaluate writing (4-8).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.Description: respond in constructive ways to others' writings (4-8).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.Description: evaluate how well his/her own writing achieves its purposes (4-8).

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.Description: present information in various forms using available technology (4-8).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.Description: evaluate his/her own research and frame new questions for further investigation (4-8).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.Description: follow accepted formats for writing research, including documenting sources (6-8).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.Description: identify challenges faced by published authors and strategies they use to compose various types of text (7-8).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.Description: use media to compare ideas and points of view (4-8).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 7

LearningStandard.Description: Reading/Fluency. Students read grade-level text with fluency and comprehension.

LearningStandard.Description: adjust fluency when reading aloud grade-level text based on the reading purpose and the nature of the text.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Reading/Vocabulary Development. Students understand new vocabulary and use it when reading and writing.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: determine the meaning of grade-level academic English words derived from Latin, Greek, or other linguistic roots and affixes.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: use context (within a sentence and in larger sections of text) to determine or clarify the meaning of unfamiliar or ambiguous words or words with novel meanings.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: complete analogies that describe a function or its description (e.g., pen:paper as chalk: ______ or soft:kitten as hard: ______).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: identify common words or word parts from other languages that are used in written English (e.g., phenomenon, charisma, chorus, pass, flora, fauna).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: use a dictionary, a glossary, or a thesaurus (printed or electronic) to determine the meanings, syllabication, pronunciations, alternate word choices, and parts of speech of words.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Comprehension of Literary Text/Theme and Genre. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about theme and genre in different cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts and provide evidence from the text to support their understandin
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: analyze literary works that share similar themes across cultures.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: compare and contrast the similarities and differences in mythologies from various cultures (e.g., ideas of afterlife, roles and characteristics of deities, purposes of myths).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: explain how the values and beliefs of particular characters are affected by the historical and cultural setting of the literary work.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Comprehension of Literary Text/Poetry. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the structure and elements of poetry and provide evidence from text to support their understanding.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: compare and contrast the relationship between the purpose and characteristics of different poetic forms (e.g., epic poetry, lyric poetry).
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Comprehension of Literary Text/Drama. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the structure and elements of drama and provide evidence from text to support their understanding.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: analyze how different playwrights characterize their protagonists and antagonists through the dialogue and staging of their plays.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Comprehension of Literary Text/Fiction. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the structure and elements of fiction and provide evidence from text to support their understanding.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: analyze linear plot developments (e.g., conflict, rising action, falling action, resolution, subplots) to determine whether and how conflicts are resolved.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: analyze how the central characters' qualities influence the theme of a fictional work and resolution of the central conflict.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: analyze different forms of point of view, including limited versus omniscient, subjective versus objective.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Comprehension of Literary Text/Literary Nonfiction. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the varied structural patterns and features of literary nonfiction and provide evidence from text to support their understanding.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: analyze passages in well-known speeches for the author's use of literary devices and word and phrase choice (e.g., aphorisms, epigraphs) to appeal to the audience.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Comprehension of Literary Text/Sensory Language. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about how an author's sensory language creates imagery in literary text and provide evidence from text to support their understanding.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: explain the effect of similes and extended metaphors in literary text.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Comprehension of Informational Text/Culture and History. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about the author's purpose in cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts and provide evidence from the text to support their understa
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: analyze works written on the same topic and compare how the authors achieved similar or different purposes.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Comprehension of Informational Text/Expository Text. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about expository text and provide evidence from text to support their understanding.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: summarize the main ideas, supporting details, and relationships among ideas in text succinctly in ways that maintain meaning and logical order.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: distinguish factual claims from commonplace assertions and opinions and evaluate inferences from their logic in text.

LearningStandard.Description: make subtle inferences and draw complex conclusions about the ideas in text and their organizational patterns.

LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: compare and contrast persuasive texts that reached different conclusions about the same issue and explain how the authors reached their conclusions through analyzing the evidence each presents.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: analyze the use of such rhetorical and logical fallacies as loaded terms, caricatures, leading questions, false assumptions, and incorrect premises in persuasive texts.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: Comprehension of Informational Text/Procedural Texts. Students understand how to glean and use information in procedural texts and documents.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: analyze text for missing or extraneous information in multi-step directions or legends for diagrams.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010

LearningStandard.Description: evaluate graphics for their clarity in communicating meaning or achieving a specific purpose.
LearningStandard.CourseTitle: English Language Arts and Reading, Grade 8, 2009-2010
